sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A Testimony against John Fenwick, concerning his proceeding about New-Cesaria or New-Jersey in the province of America. Fenwick, John, 1618-1683. Letter of condemnation sent to Friends, upon their testifying against his proceedings.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
s.n., [London : 1675]
Signed: London the 6th day of the 5th month commonly called July Anno Domini, 1675. [brace] From the people of God, called Quakers, in London. Includes John Fenwick's Letter of Condemnation sent to Friends, upon their testifying against his proceedings. Reproduction of original in the Friends' Library (London, England).
=======
A Testimony against John Fenwick, concerning his proceeding about New-Cesaria or New-Jersey in the province of America. Fenwick, John, 1618-1683. Letter of condemnation sent to Friends, upon their testifying against his proceedings.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
s.n., [London : 1675]
Signed: London the 6th day of the 5th month commonly called July Anno Domini, 1675. [brace] From the people of God, called Quakers, in London. Includes John Fenwick's Letter of Condemnation sent to Friends, upon their testifying against his proceedings. Reproduction of original in the Friends' Library (London, England).
